Package it.polimi.ingsw.gameLogic.model.match.player.personalBoard.warehouse

Class ConcreteWarehouse

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.gameLogic.model.match.player.personalBoard.warehouse.ConcreteWarehouse
All Implemented Interfaces:
Warehouse
public class ConcreteWarehouse extends Object implements Warehouse
This class implements the basic warehouse.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ConcreteWarehouse()
    The constructor initializes the three shelves with UNKNOWN type and zero quantity.

  • Method Details

    • take

      public PhysicalResource take​(int shelf, int numResources) throws NotEnoughResourcesException
      Returns the PhysicalResource in the chosen quantity, if possible, and removes it from the shelf.
      Specified by:
      take in interface Warehouse
      Parameters:
      shelf - the number of the shelf, starting from 1
      numResources - the amount of resources to take from the specified shelf
      Returns:
      the resource taken from the shelf.
      Throws:
      NotEnoughResourcesException - whenever the resource is not available on the shelf
      See Also:
      ConcreteWarehouse, ExtraShelfWarehouse

    • moveInShelf

      public boolean moveInShelf​(PhysicalResource res, int shelf) throws ShelfInsertException, InvalidQuantityException
      Moves in the specified shelf, if there is enough space or an EMPTY (quantity=0) shelf with whatever previous ResType in it. Before moving, checks for "res" presence in the market buffer.
      Specified by:
      moveInShelf in interface Warehouse
      Parameters:
      res - the resource to try to insert into the shelf (the same resource MUST be present in the market buffer before)
      shelf - the number of the shelf, starting from 1.
      Returns:
      true
      Throws:
      ShelfInsertException - for every problem space-or-type related
      InvalidQuantityException - whenever the received resource is not present in the marketBuffer first.

    • cleanMarketBuffer

      public boolean cleanMarketBuffer​(PhysicalResource res)
      Receives the resource to remove from the marketBuffer, and does it one by one.
      Specified by:
      cleanMarketBuffer in interface Warehouse
      Parameters:
      res - the resource to remove from the marketBuffer
      Returns:
      true

      public List<PhysicalResource> getWarehouseDisposition()

      Specified by:

      Returns:

    • switchShelf

      public boolean switchShelf​(int shelf1, int shelf2) throws ShelfInsertException
      The method checks for the availability of the space in both resources before switching shelves, avoiding the Undo procedure, then switches resources between the two shelves.
      Specified by:
      switchShelf in interface Warehouse
      Parameters:
      shelf1 - the first shelf
      shelf2 - the second shelf
      Returns:
      true
      Throws:
      ShelfInsertException - when the switch is impossible due to resources quantities.

    • getBuffer

      public List<PhysicalResource> getBuffer()
      Specified by:
      getBuffer in interface Warehouse
      Returns:
      the market buffer.

    • marketDraw

      public boolean marketDraw​(PhysicalResource res)
      This method, eventually, splits the received resource in more single quantities and inserts them in the marketBuffer.
      Specified by:
      marketDraw in interface Warehouse
      Parameters:
      res - the resource to insert in the buffer
      Returns:
      true

    • discardRemains

      public int discardRemains() throws InvalidOperationException
      This method clears marketBuffer and returns its previous size, for penalty faith points purposes.
      Specified by:
      discardRemains in interface Warehouse
      Returns:
      the remaining size of the buffer
      Throws:
      InvalidOperationException - when trying to discard resources that can be placed.
